main.name: Seth Way
main.description: Software Engineer & Military Veteran. Currently looking for a positive and engaging team where I can contribute while continuing to learn and grow
main.bio: Almost one year ago, I honorably completed my Military Service. Since then, I’ve graduated from the Microsoft Software & Systems Academy, and moved to Seattle. I’ve completed one of the nation’s best Software Engineering bootcamps. I’ve learned the basics and some highly advanced concepts in several programming languages. I’ve met project deadlines while working with teams of incredibly talented individuals. I’m excited and motivated to take on the next challenge.
main.contactmessage: Please leave a message or visit me on social media. I'm very receptive to any feedback or suggestions and would be excited to discuss any possibilities for collaboration.

resume.skillmessage: I've tried to honestly assess my competency with these technical skills. However, I understand that you never know everything about anything. I am continuing to learn and grow.

education.description: Hack Reactor is an immersive full-stack development program that teaches students to master advanced HTML and CSS, front-end JavaScript frameworks with React, server development with Node, and databases with SQL and Mongo during 800 hours of instruction, projects, and hands-on work.

The MSSA teaches transitioning service members the fundamentals of C# programming while building local, server based and cloud-stored applications. Concepts include database programming, data integration and manipulation, C# application programming with ASP.net MVC and application development in Azure.

work.title: Squad Leader / Shop Foreman
work.description: Mentored and managed a team of 4-8 members with responsibility for their technical and career development. Managed and delivered on approximately 100 project deadlines in a demanding, fastpaced environment that required balancing work schedules with extensive program demands. Maintained and accounted for equipment valued at $3,000,000 without loss.

work.title: Bartender / Shift Manager
work.description: Directed and collaborated with a front of house team of 14-16 employees in nightly restaurant operations to deliver a customer focused dining experience. Assisted in catering private events tailored to meet specific client needs. Adhered to company and state enforceable standards for responsible alcohol distribution without incident.
